001package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
002
003import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.max;
004import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.min;
005
006import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
007
008
009/**
010 * <p>
011 * Implementation of HLS (hue/lightness/saturation) color space.
012 * See Sec. 13.2.3 of [1] for additional details.
013 * All component values are assumed to be in [0,1].
014 * This is a singleton class with no public constructors,
015 * use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
016 * </p>
017 * <p>
018 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
019 * </p>
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 * @version 2022/09/04
023 */
024@SuppressWarnings("serial")
025public class HlsColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
026        
027        private static final HlsColorSpace instance = new HlsColorSpace();
028        
029        public static HlsColorSpace getInstance() {
030                return instance;
031        }
032        
033        private HlsColorSpace() {
034                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_HLS, 3);
035        }
036
037        @Override
038        public float[] fromRGB(float[] rgb) {
039                final float r = rgb[0], g = rgb[1], b = rgb[2]; // r, g, b assumed to be in [0,1]
040                final float cHi = max(r, g, b);         // max. component value
041                final float cLo = min(r, g, b);         // min. component value
042                final float cRng = cHi - cLo;                   // component range
043                
044                // Calculate lightness L
045                float L = (cHi + cLo) / 2;
046                
047                // Calculate saturation S               
048                float S = 0;
049                if (0 < L && L < 1) {
050                        float d = (L <= 0.5f) ? L : (1 - L);
051                        S = 0.5f * cRng / d;
052                }
053                
054                // Calculate hue H (same as in HSV)
055                float H = 0;    
056                if (cHi > 0 && cRng > 0) {        // a color pixel
057                        float dr = (cHi - r) / cRng;
058                        float dg = (cHi - g) / cRng;
059                        float db = (cHi - b) / cRng;
060                        float h;
061                        if (r == cHi)                      // R is largest component
062                                h = db - dg;
063                        else if (g == cHi)                 // G is largest component
064                                h = dr - db + 2.0f;
065                        else                               // B is largest component
066                                h = dg - dr + 4.0f;
067                        if (h < 0)
068                          h = h + 6;
069                        H = h / 6;
070                }
071                return new float[] {H, L, S};
072        }
073        
074        @Override
075        public float[] toRGB(float[] hls) {
076                final float H = hls[0], L = hls[1], S = hls[2]; // H,L,S in [0,1]
077                float r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;      
078                if (L <= 0)                             // black
079                        r = g = b = 0;
080                else if (L >= 1)                // white
081                        r = g = b = 1;
082                else {
083                        float hh = (6 * H) % 6;
084                        int   c1 = (int) hh;
085                        float c2 = hh - c1;
086                        float d = (L <= 0.5f) ? (S * L) : (S * (1 - L));
087                        float w = L + d;
088                        float x = L - d;
089                        float y = w - (w - x) * c2;
090                        float z = x + (w - x) * c2;
091                        switch (c1) {
092                                case 0: r = w; g = z; b = x; break;
093                                case 1: r = y; g = w; b = x; break;
094                                case 2: r = x; g = w; b = z; break;
095                                case 3: r = x; g = y; b = w; break;
096                                case 4: r = z; g = x; b = w; break;
097                                case 5: r = w; g = x; b = y; break;
098                                default: // this should not happen
099                        }                       
100                }       // r, g, b in [0,1]
101                return new float[] {r, g, b};
102        }
103
104        @Override
105        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
106                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
107        }
108
109        @Override
110        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] colorvalue) {
111                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
112        }
113        
114        private static final String[] ComponentNames = {"H", "L", "S"};
115        
116        @Override
117        public String getName (int idx) {
118                return ComponentNames[idx];
119        }
120
121}
